column4: would someone mind taking a look at this link for me and explaining it...I cant figure it out...

Thanks mate
It's the last response I cant work out
ok...  so you just need help installing SAMBA and configuring your printer to be shared through it?
Fun#

Yeah....I think my description of the issue was fairly straightforward....when I am logged into windows, the Linux machine upstrairs can see the printer and print ok.  However, when I have logged into Ubuntu down here, the Linux machine upstrais can no longer see the printer
yea, it's just because you don't have ubuntu configured to share the printer.
Ahhh ok...well any help you can give will be greatly appreciated mate

you really should just follow the link the last post had:   http://samba.org/samba/docs/man/Samba-HOWTO-Collection/     it will help you configure samba to share the printer...    to install samba just do     sudo apt-get install samba           in the console
right installed
Installed
This is WAYYY over my head mate...I've only been using Linux for a little over a week :(
sorry man, i'm looking for a guide for you
unfortunately whta you want to do is going to be over any ones head who is new to linux
Thanks mate
Not great news by the looks of it....the computer upstairs is for the children to print thier homework off on...I just dont want to have to log into windows so they can print
here you go:    http://ubuntuguide.org/wiki/Ubuntu_Edgy#Print_Server_.28cupsd.29
I suppose the solution is to get another local printer
no, follow the link I just sent you:   http://ubuntuguide.org/wiki/Ubuntu_Edgy#Print_Server_.28cupsd.29
Thanks mate.....looking now

Reading now...however, with my limited knowledge Samba and Cupsys work differently...therefore I would need to essentially set up two printers on the Linux machine upstairs....one for when the machine downstairs is logged into windows, and one for when I am logged into Linux?  Is that right?
